summary: Cargill is a huge American company that works in food and farming. It was started in 1865 and is now the biggest private company in the U.S. by revenue. They do many things, like trading and selling crops, making food ingredients, and raising animals. Cargill also works in energy and finance. It has over 160,000 employees worldwide and is a big supplier of grain, meat, and salt. The company is still owned by the founder's family. In 2022, Cargill made $165 billion in revenue.
title: Cargill
